alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:14PM MST until July 14 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The city of Prescott and Iron Springs in Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 230 PM MST. * At 1214 PM MST, Doppler Radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicates around 1 inch of rain in an hour. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Indian Hill West Prescott, Yavapai Campground, Oak Knoll Village, Prescott Gateway Mall, Prescott Airport, Iron Springs, Groom Creek Subdivision, White Spar Campground and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 290 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 307 and 321. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 320. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Tonto Wash, Bannon Creek, Willow Creek, Granite Creek, Little Chino Valley, Iron Springs Wash, Bottleneck Wash, Spence Creek, Skull Valley Wash, Chaparral Gulch, Butte Creek, Mint Wash, Wolf Creek, Miller Creek, Hassayampa River, Lynx Creek and Woolsey Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
